text: Is the eye red?
Is the eye swollen or puffy?
Is the eyeball protruding (exophthalmos)?
Is there any ocular discharge?
Amount of discharge?
Does the dog seem to be in pain (e.g., squinting, pawing at eye)?
Is the dog sensitive to light (photophobic)?
Is the dog squinting or blinking excessively (blepharospasm)?
Is there evidence of vision loss?
Is the cornea cloudy or opaque?
Is there bluish corneal swelling (corneal edema)?
Is there evidence of a corneal ulcer?
Are there new blood vessels on the cornea?
Is there white/yellow fluid in the anterior chamber (hypopyon)?
Is there blood in the anterior chamber (hyphema)?
Has the color of the iris changed?
What is the pupil size?
Do the pupils respond to light?
Is there excessive tearing?
Is the third eyelid elevated?
Is there a mass on the eyelid?
Is there a mass on the conjunctiva?
Is there swelling of the conjunctiva (chemosis)?
Is there any bleeding from the eye?
Are abnormal eye movements present?
Are there systemic signs (lethargy, fever)?
Are both eyes affected?
Is the dog a breed predisposed to ocular disease (e.g., brachycephalic)?
Has the dog experienced recent eye trauma?
Is the dog blinking more than usual?
Is the lens of the eye cloudy?
Has the dog recently undergone eye surgery?
Is the dog tilting its head frequently?
Does the dog struggle to see in low light?
Have you noticed behavioral changes (agitation, lethargy)?
Has intraocular pressure tested high?
Is there staining of fur around the eyes from tears?
Did vision loss occur suddenly?
Are the eyes unusually dry?
Is there crusting around the eyes?
Is the dog squinting?
Is the dog rubbing or pawing at its eyes?
Are the eyes bulging outward?
Are the eyes sunken or smaller than normal?
Do the dog's pupils appear different in size?
Has the lens moved from its normal position?
Are the eyelids twitching or spasming?
Is there rapid flickering of the eyes?
Does the dog have a double row of eyelashes?
Are tear drops falling continuously?
Are there prominent blood vessels on the eye?
Is there a growth or mass on the eye?
Is there bruising around the eye?
Does the dog show discomfort when the eye is touched?
Does the eye feel harder than normal?
Does the eye feel softer than normal?
Is there a visible glare in the eye?
Are the eyelids drooping?
Are the eyelids rolling inward?
Are the eyelids rolling outward?
Are the eyelids thickened?
Is there scaling on the eyelids?
Is there debris in the eye?
Does vision fluctuate between good and poor?
Is the dog avoiding bright light?
Is there burning around the eye?
Is there discharge mainly at night?
Does the dog produce excessive tears?
Is there a squishing sound when pressing the eye?
Does the eye discharge smell foul?
Has the eye color changed recently?
Has the eye popped out of the socket previously?
Has the eye contacted chemicals recently?
Has the dog recently traveled to new areas?
Are there ticks around the eye area?
Is there a concurrent ear infection?
Does the dog have respiratory symptoms too?
Are the paws swollen from scratching?
Has the dog lost weight recently?
Has the dog's appetite changed?
Is there scarring on the eye surface?
Is the eye surface whitish or milky?
Does the dog react strongly to sharp noises?
Is there neck pain when moving the head?
Has the dog been vaccinated recently?
Does the dog have a history of diabetes?
Is the dog diagnosed with an immune-mediated disease?
Are there other neurologic signs present?
